Penguin Book Design

About

A project for the class Graphic Design 1. The main goal of the proejct was to redesign the book cover for Murder Most Unladylike by Robin Stevens in a more updated way. Since this prompt came from Penguin Books, a template was provided for the book size with the puffin logos and barcode as well.

Design Process

  • Read the book to glean the tone and story details that could potentially be on the cover
  • Sketch initial ideas and recieve feedback from peers
  • Refine the best idea and create a comp in computer
  • Recieve more feedback and fix issues from the feedback

Design Decisions

The story is set in 1930’s at a middle school girl’s boarding school and had a lighthearted tone. The audience for the book is 9-12 year olds so I chose to keep the cover fun while also echoing some of the scenes from the book. The person carting the body in the wheelbarrow, the broken window, and the girls sneaking around at night were all moments in the book that wouldn’t give anything away to a potential reader while rewarding those who have gotten to those points in the story already.
